SENT.plain: Cerebral venous thrombosis developing concurrently with active ulcerative colitis poses a therapeutic dilemma
We report the case of a 31-year-old woman who developed dural venous sinus thrombosis during the course of active ulcerative colitis in whom we accomplished clot lysis using intrasinus urokinase
The success of the procedure was assessed by improvement in the patient's neurological condition and resolution of imaging features without any bleeding complications
We also reviewed literature on various modalities of treatment of sinus venous thrombosis in patients with ulcerative colitis and outcome
